Description: Lower bowl and conical foot sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian, possibly Mature Animal Style or Grand Style, pottery heavy chalice; interior of bowl glazed black with rosette petal in added white in centre of bowl; exterior slipped white; reserved at base of bowl, glazed on foot with traces of white bands near top of foot and two white bands near bottom of foot; edge of foot reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The thickness of the sherd suggests that it belongs to a heavy chalice or heavy chalice. Theses types of vessels are found in the Mature Animal Style and Grand Style.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1350) (phase 2)
